title: "TensorDimensionIndexSelection"

<!-- DO NOT EDIT! This file was auto-generated by crates/build/re_types_builder/src/codegen/docs/mod.rs -->

Indexing a specific tensor dimension.

Selecting `dimension=2` and `index=42` is similar to doing `tensor[:, :, 42, :, :, ‚Ä¶]` in numpy.

## Fields
#### `dimension`
Type: `uint32`

The dimension number to select.

#### `index`
Type: `uint64`

The index along the dimension to use.


## Arrow datatype
```
Struct {
    dimension: uint32
    index: uint64
}
```
